intro: Mendoncia leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Mendoncia leucantha is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
